definition: in an instant a myriad changes (idiom); rapid substantial change
breath/news/interest (on an investment or loan)/to cease/to stop/to rest/Taiwan pr. [xi2]
to change/to become different/to transform/to vary/rebellion

sentences.english: Because we cannot accept the truth of transience, we suffer.
sentences.chinese: 我们无法接受瞬息万变这一真理，因此我们为之痛苦。

sentences.english: Crops grown on irrigated land are not dependent on the vagaries of the weather.
sentences.chinese: 生长于灌溉农地的作物不依赖于天气的瞬息万变。

sentences.english: Life as we know it can change in the blink of an eye.
sentences.chinese: 生活就如我们所想象那般，眨眼间瞬息万变。

sentences.english: The objective world is constantly changing.
sentences.chinese: 外面世界是瞬息万变的。

sentences.english: Summits are higher and can be very windy, and the weather can change on a dime.
sentences.chinese: 峰顶比较高，风会很大，天气也是瞬息万变。

sentences.english: The more things seems to change, the more they seem to stay the same.
sentences.chinese: 事物越是看似瞬息万变，其实它们越是恒久不变。

sentences.english: The political landscape was changing as quickly as a fast-moving computer game.
sentences.chinese: 政坛风云变幻之迅速如同瞬息万变的电脑游戏。

definition: to change according to the situation (idiom); pragmatic
nothing much changes (idiom); always the same/stuck in a rut
to judge the hour and size up the situation/to take stock
to meet a contingency/to adapt oneself to changes
to surge like a gathering storm (idiom)/to grow by leaps and bounds
free to come and go (idiom)/to have room to maneuver
